DOC.brief_summary: Very premature infants with a large ductus, selected by an early echocardiogram, will receive either ibuprofen or placebo before 12 hours of life. Follow-up will include repeated echocardiograms and cranial ultrasound at 36 hours, 14 days and 36 weeks of postconceptional age. The primary outcome will be survival without cerebral palsy at years.
DOC.brief_title: Early Ibuprofen Treatment of Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA) in Premature Infants (TRIOCAPI)
DOC.criteria: Gestational less than 28 weeks Postnatal age less than 12 hours
